name: Rusty Parrot Lodge and Spa

reviews.title: not bad, but not great
reviews.text: I rarely write these reviews, but thought there were a few pts. to note about this hotel. First of all, i booked an upper room, which was really bascially on the first floor, the lower rooms are basically in the basement. The rooms are comfy but look more similar to an upscale hotel chain, then a luxury lodge. And while we were lucky and had a little patio there were no views for any of the rooms, except streets or parking lot. I had a massage which was nice, but there is no real spa, u have your treatments in various rooms aruond the hotel. The dinner failed in comaprison to the price, it was fine but nothing to write home about. It was a nice hotel, but not as much as a treat as i expected. There are far better places, esp. for the price. PS. the breakfeast was amazing, but the cook was not very friendly to some other guests who made minimal extra requests.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When you walk in a hotel and they greet you by name and wish you a "Happy Birthday", you know you've made the right choice. When the bellman arrives 5 minutes later with chocolate covered strawberries as a gift from the staff, you're a little overwhelmed. When you call the front desk to ask where to get a picnic for hiking and their favorite place's menu appears under your door as you hang up the phone...you know you're in heaven.
reviews.title: Awesome!

likes.disliked: — no coffee pots in the rooms

reviews.text: Yes, the Rusty Parrot is a pretty place with great food and a nice ambience but what sets this hotel apart is the incredible staff. They are extremely professional, efficient and just plain nice.
reviews.title: Fantastic food, nice spa, okay rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We probably would have had a good weekend anywhere because Jackson Hole is such a great destination...However, the staff at Rusty Parrot turned a good weekend into a weekend we'll never forget!
reviews.title: Great Hotel

likes.disliked: — A little too far from downtown. Four blocks.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Rusty Parrot the 2nd week of October. The highs and middlin lows:
reviews.title: Charming and Comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a very special place. We stayed two nights in a King size room with fireplace and jacuzzi tub. It was warm, comfortable, very clean, great linens, great bed and pillows. Very quiet, too, so you can sleep late or take a nap. The breakfast is custom cook to order daily and is outstanding. The staff are amazing. There is satellite TV, WIFI, coffee, tea, cookies, and fruit all the time. The bathroom supplies are Occidental, outstanding. The tub in our room was amazing, my husband and I took baths together, totally romantic. The teton park is fantastic; the hiking amazing. I wish I had stayed longer, highly recommend.
reviews.title: I love this place

likes.liked: — the bed, plillows, tub, and bathroom

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was one of the most amazing places I have ever stayed. Our price included breakfast everyday and the staff made us feel as if we were at home. This was the first hotel in my world travels that I have ever had a curfew to return back to by 930 each nite to sit in the hot tub under the full moon. The rooms were very romantic so make sure you are in the mood to be pampered!
reviews.title: Loved Loved Loved this place!

likes.liked: — The staff, the food and the location...oops and the deck with the hot tub and the rooms...!!
likes.disliked: — The price...just because i must give something in this category

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The sharp eyed reader may notice that this is our second review of the Rusty Parrot and our third of Jackson. For a couple of Brits to visit JH 3 times in 3 years in the summer might seem strange, but we just love the place - we are probably going back there next summer as well.
reviews.title: Still the best in Jackson

reviews.text: We first stayed in the RP in 2006 but had to cut short our stay for an emergency return to the UK - and we vowed to return to the area. We duly did in 2007 but stayed up the road at the Inn on the Creek as we planned to spend very little time in the hotel - but our 4 day stay convinced us that JH was worth a two week stay and we decided to return to the Rusty Parrot.
reviews.title: A Special Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First the basics - the hotel is ideally suited for both the town and for getting out to the Tetons and Yellowstone. It is on a quiet grassy square about 5 minutes walk into the old town with its restaurants, shops and galleries. There is a good sized parking lot at the rear, plus plenty of close street parking directly opposite.
reviews.title: Kudos to the Rusty Parrott

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I love the Rusty Parrot. The staff are friendly and helpful and they really cared about our total vacation experience. The small lodge is in the town of Jackson and within walking distance of restaurants, shopping and services but slightly removed and quiet, overlooking a local park. The beds with plentiful pillows and the rooms are very comfortable. The hotel's small library area, magazine selection, and outside deck with hot tub are great amenities. Although we could have done without the sample of cowboy poetry left in our room every night, we did take a shine to the stuffed bear in our room and purchased her to take home with us. The Wild Sage restaurant is outstanding for its full breakfast (included in the room charge) and its dinner selections. The servers are professional and friendly (not always the case even in higher priced properties in Jackson Hole). We spent 5 nights at the Rusty Parrot and we would definitely return again.
reviews.title: Would love to return to the Rusty Parrot

likes.disliked: — The yellow jackets or wasps on the deck

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 days at the beginning of July, the first part of our Grand Tetons & Yellowstone vacation. it was definitely the upscale part! The staff was helpful & friendly, the room was delightful, the included breakfast was delicious and the location was perfect. It felt like a private little inn, which is I guess exactly what it is.
reviews.title: A little gem

likes.disliked: — Dinner at the Wild Sage restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only quibble is that we ate at the Wild Sage dining room for dinner one night and while it was a perfect experience, the food was only acceptable. For the price, it should have been spectacular.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!

reviews.text: This year marked our 2nd trip to the Rusty Parrot and we will be back next year.
reviews.title: Luxurious Wild West

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were very friendly and helpful (especially loading/unloading skis), the breakfasts are great, and the hotel itself is clean and comfortable. The ski packages that include lift tickets are a fantastic deal--check the hotel website for details.
reviews.title: Love the Rusty Parrot!!!

likes.liked: — Fresh baked cookies, wonderful breakfast & very comfortable room
likes.disliked: — Price is high but worth it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for four nights in August, visiting JH for a family wedding. This is a pleasant boutique hotel, more like a bed and breakfast than hotel – the desk shuts down overnight and there is no room service.
reviews.title: Good, not great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room, 301, is a king fireplace room next to the 2nd floor library and overlooking a park. A small balcony with comfortable chairs is accessible by sliding glass doors with screens. The room is very small but nicely arranged. There is a small desk, large armchair, and large armoir housing the tv. The fireplace is raised and separates the bed area from the bath area. There is no door for the sink and bath (drafty after showering and no privacy) but there is a door to the toilet. The sink area has little space for toiletries; much of it is taken up with the ice bucket and glasses and amenties holder. The soap dish is flat, and our soap (never replaced during our four nights) sat in water that was never drained. Odd: a lip balm stick was included (would have been welcome in the dry air) but it was unsealed, so I assumed it had been used. It was never replaced after I threw it out the first day.
reviews.title: A comfortable bed, a big bathtub, and a great breakfast

likes.liked: — Staff, convenient location, the bed, (included) breakfast
likes.disliked: — Requests made EIGHT MONTHS IN ADVANCE were not granted

reviews.title: Rusty Parrot
reviews.text: The breakfast was excellent but the setup extremely confusing. When I talked to the manager about a different issue (poorly resolved) after we returned home, he told me they are rewriting information to make the breakfast process clearer. The woman running breakfast, Chelsea, was attentive and welcoming, however, and she made the experience a delight for us. Both cooked food and cold buffet items were highest quality and included very good fruits and baked goods.

I did not feel the staff was indifferent, as others mentioned, but it did seem as if there is no consistent management. An example: Since there are no cofffeemakers in room, I asked at the desk if we could get some coffee before we left at 6am for our flight; the desk person said coffee would be available by 5:45, and we would be given snacks to take with us. We watched as he wrote it all down, but - no coffee, no snacks, no explanation (desk is not open that early). In my subsequent discussion with the manager, he did say they had trouble finding staff.
reviews.title: Nice inn, but best for adults
Great Choice
reviews.text: As my disappointment over not being granted reservations requests fades and dissipates into the ether, I am left with a largely positive feeling about this place.

description: The standard of the lodge industry, it is located in downtown Jackson, a stroll from all the touristy, but feels almost like country living.
